document.topic_text: FDAnews Announces: Promoting Prescription Drugs on Social Media Workshop, Oct. 19-20, 2016, Arlington, VA Share Article Numerous drug companies have a successful social media presence. How can other companies join them, reaping the sales and marketing benefits while satisfying the FDA at the same time? Promoting Prescription Drugs on Social Media Past News Releases Falls Church, VA (PRWEB) August 22, 2016 Promoting Prescription Drugs on Social Media **Presented by FDAnews and PhillyCooke Consulting ** Oct. 19-20, 2016 – Arlington, VA http://www.fdanews.com/promotingprescriptiondrugsonsocialmedia Marketers dream of social media’s reach. Patients are using it — learning about their conditions — and talking to their doctors about what they’ve discovered. However, it can become a regulatory nightmare for drugmakers if well-designed policies and procedures aren’t in place. Numerous drug companies have a successful social media presence. How can other companies join them, reaping the sales and marketing benefits while satisfying the FDA at the same time? Make the dream come true and learn much more by registering to attend the FDAnews workshop Promoting Prescription Drugs on Social Media on October 19-20, 2016, in Arlington, VA. Attendees will get a detailed look at the latest developments from the FDA and its regulatory requirements, with a deep dive into the intricacies of the three most prominent platforms: Facebook, Twitter and YouTube. Attendees will walk away with a full understanding of the complexities of developing a compliant social media platform and be equipped with the right tools to use social media. By participating in this interactive workshop attendees will: Understand the state of FDA guidance o What the agency has and has not clarified o What’s likely to change Engage with the full range of social media use cases o Customer engagement
